content: crochet a set of reusable cotton scrubbies for your kitchen or bath these are large enough to be luxurious for skincare routines but still small enough to work for a variety of purposes in your kitchen ***this crochet pattern is available for free on my website visit pattern website link above or you can download it here on ravelry as a print-optimized ad-free pdf *** **difficulty ** easy *techniques used puff stitches crochet in the back bar picot single_crochet reverse single_crochet crab stitch invisible join * **materials needed ** 3 25mm d hook 3mm hook for smaller round scrubby 20-25 yards #4 worsted weight lily sugar n cream cotton yarn 25 yards floral scrubbie 20 yards round scrubbie in colors of your choice pictured are coral rose tangerine and ecru yarn needle scissors **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet rsc = reverse single_crochet crab stitch **additional terms ** *puff * yo pull up a loop 3 times in same st yo pull through 6 loops yo pull through final 2 loops *picot single_crochet psc * insert hook through top of stitch yo pull up a loop yo draw through 1 loop 3 times making a chain 3 yo draw through final 2 loops on hook pull your chain-3 space towards the front of your work instead of pushing it toward the back *back bar of single_crochet * look at the back of the stitch and locate the short bar that runs horizontal work all stitches for the round into this bar this is a different location than the back loop blo = back loop only space/sps = space/spaces st/sts = stitch/stitches prev = previous skip = skip **gauge ** gauge is not particularly important for this project **measurements ** round scrubby 3 3/4 across flower scrubby 4 3/4 across **additional notes ** chain-1 at beginning of round does not count as a stitch use tight gauge for this project so that your scrubby will be more sturdy pull your joins tight to minimize the seam this pattern includes a short picture tutorial on how to work the invisible join at the end of the round scrubby this technique works on any project worked in the round using single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet and treble_crochet stitches to name a few always rinse your scrubbies out well and let them fully dry between uses to prevent mildew or musty smells an afternoon soak in a mixture of borax and water can get the day old dishrag smell out but if odors still persist after that toss them out and crochet another set
